title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 March 2014 - XWiki
content:

10:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:25 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
10:28 <vmassol> We need to plan the 5.4.3 and 6.0M1 releases  
10:28 <tmortagne> yep  
10:29 <vmassol> mflorea: I see the 2 remaining issues are still open on http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?filter=12690&jql=project%20in%20(XCOMMONS%2C%20XRENDERING%2C%20XWIKI%2C%20XE)%20AND%20resolution%20%3D%20Unresolved%20AND%20fixVersion%20%3D%20%225.4.3%22  
10:29 <tmortagne> 6.0M1 looks ready to me  
10:29 <vmassol> but XWIKI-9595 seems fixed  
10:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: mflorea is still busy I believe so ideally we would need someone to replace him just for 6.0M1  
10:30 <vmassol> to release 6.0M1 today  
10:30 <mflorea> vmassol: I'm closing XWIKI-9595 in a few minutes, but I still have XWIKI-9716  
10:31 <vmassol> this test has failed for the last  2 builds on master: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/2926/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes/DateClassFieldTest/testDatePicker/  
10:31 <tmortagne> yes the other issue is a bit of work I guess so I can take care of 6.0M1 if needed  
10:31 <vmassol> ok that'd be cool  
10:31 <vmassol> we need to ensure this datepicker test is not a real issue first  
10:31 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <evalica> has quit  
10:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/ has been failing for a long time too  
10:32 <vmassol> (since 21st)  
10:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's related to latest mflorea changes I think  
10:32 <mflorea> yes  
10:32 <vmassol> 12 tests failing, must be a real issue  
10:32 <tmortagne> not the lastes actually  
10:32 <tmortagne> the changes before that  
10:32 <tmortagne> not a real issue but UI change  
10:33 <vmassol> I mean not a flicker  
10:33 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <vmassol> same on 5.4.x branch actually  
10:33 <tmortagne> same change on 5.4 yes  
10:34 <msmeria> has quit  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <gdelhumeau> Hi guys!  
10:58 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: what is your status for 5.4.3?  
10:58 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: good morning, see irc history for this morning :)  
10:59 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: I posted above  
10:59 <mflorea> (11:30:42) mflorea: vmassol: I'm closing XWIKI-9595 in a few minutes, but I still have XWIKI-9716  
10:59 <gdelhumeau> ok thx  
11:10 <tmortagne> mflorea: could http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/5184/console be caused by your commits ?  
11:11 <tmortagne> "[ERROR] .../src/main/webapp/resources/uicomponents/extension/extension.js:line 732:column 122:unterminated string literal"  
11:11 <mflorea> yes  
11:11 <mflorea> I'll fix it  
11:12 <woshilapin> has quit  
11:14 <spu7nic> Greetings :)  
11:15 <spu7nic> Can the queryFilters paramter be used to add custom filtering to a livetable? Or does it only support predefined named filters?  
11:15 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <vmassol> spu7nic: custom work too :)  
11:16 <vmassol> they're the component hint  
11:17 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you have a few 6.0 issues closed without associated documentation  
11:17 <tmortagne> same for mflorea  
11:17 <gdelhumeau> ok  
11:18 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%226.0-milestone-1%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Fixed%22%29%20and%20%28%28Documentation%20is%20EMPTY%29%20or%20%28%22Documentation%20in%20Release%20Notes%22%20is%20EMPTY%29%29  
11:18 <mflorea> I know  
11:18 <spu7nic> vmassol: component hint? :)  
11:20 <vmassol> sbalaoul: internally this is what happens:                 QueryFilter queryFilter = this.componentManager.getInstance(QueryFilter.class, filter);  
11:20 <vmassol> so the name you pass correspond to a component hont  
11:20 <vmassol> \*hint  
11:21 <vmassol> if you wish to add your own custom filter, you need to develop it in java  
11:22 <vmassol> (you can find a few tutorials on xwiki.org for writing java components)  
11:23 <spu7nic> vmassol: thanks :)  
11:42 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <fcharton> has left #xwiki  
11:58 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <msmeria1> has quit  
12:00 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: what is the extension id for http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Bootstrap+Framework ?  
12:01 <vmassol> do we have a bootstrap extension?  
12:01 <gdelhumeau> no we do not  
12:01 <vmassol> then it's wrong :)  
12:01 <vmassol> extensions are for .. extensions :)  
12:01 <gdelhumeau> I mean  
12:01 <vmassol> it should go in the platform dev guide instead  
12:01 <gdelhumeau> We will have it as soon is is built  
12:02 <gdelhumeau> exactly like http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Colibri+Skin  
12:02 <vmassol> this is a skin  
12:02 <vmassol> bootstrap is not a skin  
12:02 <vmassol> flamingo is a skin  
12:02 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <vmassol> so the extension will be flamingo no?  
12:02 <vmassol> for me  
12:03 <gdelhumeau> yes ok, it is ok for flamingo, but not for bootstrap  
12:03 <vmassol> it looks like bootstrap will be integrated in the web module  
12:03 <tmortagne> that's were it is right now at least  
12:03 <vmassol> xwiki-platform-web  
12:03 <vmassol> so the question is :  
12:03 <vmassol> will it make sense to split -web in 2?  
12:03 <vmassol> or not?  
12:03 <gdelhumeau> maybe it should be there: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/FrontendResources  
12:04 <vmassol> yes sure it should go there for now  
12:04 <vmassol> (this was my point)  
12:04 <tmortagne> best would be that we don't have boostrap at all in our source...  
12:04 <vmassol> of course we shouldn't have bootstrap :)  
12:05 <vmassol> but I guess it's not about bootstrap itself  
12:05 <vmassol> but about integration with bootstrap  
12:05 <tmortagne> note: http://search.maven.org/#search|ga|1|bootstrap  
12:05 <vmassol> so to recap  
12:05 <vmassol> this doc should be moved to the dev guide for now  
12:05 <vmassol> and we'll see later in the future if we need some kind of "bootstrap"' extesnion or not  
12:05 <vmassol> (probably not)  
12:05 <vmassol> agree gdelhumeau?  
12:05 <tmortagne> I don't see much from us in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/uicomponents/bootstrap3  
12:06 <tmortagne> it looks like pure bootstrap  
12:06 <vmassol> indeed  
12:06 <vmassol> now  
12:06 <vmassol> maybe we want to have xwiki work without an internet connection  
12:06 <vmassol> so we would need to provide bootstrap  
12:06 <tmortagne> I never suggested to not bundle bootstrap  
12:06 <gdelhumeau> there is a fix to get the XWIki URL of glyphicons  
12:06 <tmortagne> I'm talking about git  
12:06 <vmassol> ok  
12:07 <vmassol> indeed it's very very bad  
12:07 <vmassol> to have it in our sources  
12:07 <vmassol> especially with the webjar integration I did  
12:07 <tmortagne> which is why I ondicated http://search.maven.org/#search|ga|1|bootstrap  
12:07 <vmassol> @tmortagne: I did a webjar integration for this  
12:07 <tmortagne> i.e. boostrap in in maven  
12:07 <gdelhumeau> yes I wanted to look at the webdav integration  
12:07 <vmassol> webjar  
12:07 <vmassol> not webdav :)  
12:07 <gdelhumeau> \*ebjar  
12:07 <tmortagne> vmassol: even without webjar  
12:07 <tmortagne> we can do exactly what we do with skins  
12:08 <vmassol> webjar is much nicer  
12:08 <vmassol> it handles js dependencies, is maintained by 3rd parties, etc  
12:09 <vmassol> there's no meantoime  
12:09 <vmassol> webjar is working \*\*now\*\*  
12:10 <vmassol> and if not, I'd like to know because that's our plan  
12:10 <vmassol> (to use webjars for js/css resources)  
12:14 <mflorea> tmortagne: there are 2 (Extension)RepositoryTest failing, related to the way the description field is computed. I remember you did some changes recently. maybe you can take a look. Ignore the failing ExtensionTests, I'm taking care of that.  
12:15 <tmortagne> mflorea: that's weird I fixed those test where they were failing  
12:16 <tmortagne> hmm looks like those test are failing since saturday  
12:17 <tmortagne> so it's new things  
12:17 <gdelhumeau> so I remove the documentation  
12:17 <gdelhumeau> I rremove bootstrap too from web  
12:17 <gdelhumeau> and I use webjar  
12:20 <tmortagne> mflorea: those new failing repository tests have nothing to do with description field  
12:20 <mflorea> the assert is on the description field, at least that is what I could reproduce locall  
12:21 <mflorea> expected [] but got "summary2"  
12:21 <tmortagne> mflorea: not in jenkins  
12:21 <tmortagne> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/2470/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui.repository/RepositoryTest/testImportExtension/ is on line 351  
12:22 <tmortagne> and RepositoryTest.testAddExtension does not have anything to do with import  
12:22 <tmortagne> one failing test is a failing attachment put through REST  
12:23 <tmortagne> and the other cannot find some field  
12:24 <tmortagne> mflorea: I doubt you are testing up to date code, it does not expect empty string anywhere anymore  
12:25 <tmortagne> and "summary2" is not what you should get for the description  
12:25 <ClemensR> tmortagne: I \*trhought\* I fixed some Extension tests https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6f36200506c3c3c0507d29fd713f8d41ed375a1e   but since then all tests on jenkins are failing  
12:25 <ClemensR> for reasons I cannot understand - locally I have only two failing tests  
12:25 <ClemensR> I can rollback that change and see if it helps  
12:25 <tmortagne> ClemensR: I doubt your commit is related to reporitory app  
12:26 <tmortagne> but for extension UI maybe, mflorea would know better  
12:26 <ClemensR> it is relates to the extension tests there it should fix the selectors for the log messsages  
12:29 <mflorea> ClemensR: thanks for the fix you did, I'm handling the remaining failures  
12:29 <ClemensR> on jenkins the problem is that the test extensions are not found at all, something I cannot reproduce locally  
12:30 <mflorea> tmortagne: indeed, I had an old XE, with the last one only testAddExtension fails  
12:30 <mflorea>  expected:<[extension description]> but was:<[]>  
12:30 <tmortagne> mflorea: does not fail anymore in latest jenkins build it seems  
12:30 <ClemensR> locally I only got two failing tests, and they fail to fetch the text of the <div> inside of the <li> for the job messages - possibly firefox brwoser foo  
12:31 <mflorea> ClemensR: again, I'm handling those  
12:31 <tmortagne> there is only two remaining failing test in jekins now too  
12:32 <ClemensR> ah, yes, that are the same two that I can reproduce locally, and mflorea looking into  
12:46 <gdelhumeau> $services.webjars returns null  
12:48 <gdelhumeau> vmassol:  
12:53 <gdelhumeau> Note  
12:53 <gdelhumeau> I have also included the sources of bootstrap in my skin flamingo  
12:54 <gdelhumeau> because I need the LESS sources to use some of their utililies  
12:54 <gdelhumeau> actually, the bootstrap integration I have done before is only usefull for JS and pictures  
12:58 <gdelhumeau> it looks like webjars in not bundled in XE  
13:07 <polx> has quit  
13:08 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
13:19 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I have added webjars to xwiki-enterprise-web and it works  
13:19 <vmassol> cool, how do you use it?  
13:19 <vmassol> requirejs?  
13:19 <gdelhumeau> yes  
13:20 <vmassol> excellent  
13:32 <mflorea> has quit  
13:35 <hhhannes> has joined #xwiki  
13:37 <hhhannes> hello there, i am trying to setup ldap authentication for xwiki 5.4.2 and except exceptions, I do not receive any debug messages as seen in http://pastebin.com/RNhetC1a  
13:37 <hhhannes> The ldap server is reachable by ping and ldapsearch works fine, too. any help is appreciated.  
13:38 <sbalaoul> is now known as <sbaloul>  
13:52 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:03 <evalica1> has quit  
14:17 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:20 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
14:20 <tmortagne> hhhannes: according to your log looks like you enabled debug log for XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl only  
14:21 <tmortagne> I think you would have more information if it was enabled for com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.ldap package too  
14:21 <tmortagne> hmm maybe not actually  
14:22 <tmortagne> but anyway looks like your issue if that the server stopped the conection for some reason  
14:22 <tmortagne> the root error is "java.net.SocketException: Connection reset"  
14:23 <tmortagne> and that's the server closing the connexion unexpectedly as far as I understand  
14:26 <tmortagne> actually I take back what I took back, you definitely have something missing in your log that is supposed to come with enabled com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.ldap package  
14:27 <tmortagne> you should get somethinsg telling you what it's trying to conect to: "LOGGER.debug("Connection to LDAP server [host:port]"  
14:27 <tmortagne> check http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HEnableLDAPdebuglog  
14:28 <tmortagne> that would at least tells you if you have the right configuration  
14:28 <tmortagne> maybe you used wrong host or port  
14:32 <hhhannes> +tmortagne: enabling debug mode for the other module was a great hint. now I see that the settings made in xwiki.cfg seem not to be activated. xwiki uses the settings i made in the LDAP  section in the Admin GUI. Do you know where these settings are saved to?  
14:33 <OSIMasson> has quit  
14:33 <tmortagne> hhhannes: yes setup at wiki level has priority, it's stored in on object in XWiki.XWikiPreferences page  
14:34 <hhhannes> +tmortagne: i am quite new to xwiki. how can i delete this object or at the least the ldap settings for this object?  
14:34 <tmortagne> this page automatically redirect to admin in view mode but you can access it directly using something like http://myhost/xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=object  
14:35 <tmortagne> don't delete that object  
14:35 <tmortagne> this is very important object  
14:35 <tmortagne> but empty all LDAP setup you find in there  
14:35 <tmortagne> it's the XWiki.XWikiPreferences object  
14:37 <hhhannes> +mortagne: maybe you have one last hint for me before i continue digging myself: is it necessary to restart tomcat after making changes to xwiki.cfg?  
14:38 <tmortagne> hhhannes: yes  
14:38 <tmortagne> xwiki.cfg is loaded at startup  
14:52 <sbaloul> has quit  
14:53 <DarkKnightCZ> any ideas, what could cause data incostinency when using clustered xwiki? two nodes, clustered database (percona xtradb cluster), if something is changed on node 1, change is shown on node 2 immediatelly, if something is changed on node 2, node 1 has old value (there are correct data in database) -> node 1 shows correct value after xwiki restart  
14:56 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: when you modify a document on 1, view it on 2 and then modify it on 1 again is 2 ok when you refresh it ?  
14:57 <hhhannes> +tmortagne: thank you very much for now, i see much better error messages now :)  
14:57 <tmortagne> hhhannes: cool :)  
14:57 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: there is a bunch on thing that could produce that but it all depends how you configured XWiki clustering  
14:58 <tmortagne> there is quite an infinite possibility of jgroups configurations...  
14:59 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yep, i thought of jgroups misconfiguration too, just testing something  
15:06 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau, mflorea: is 6.0M1 ready on your side ? I see that jenkins seems to be happy with it  
15:07 <mflorea> tmortagne: not really, there is an extension test still failing, I'm currently fixing it  
15:08 <mflorea> testUninstall, because the question to delete the unused pages appear  
15:08 <tmortagne> mflorea: well not on jenkins  
15:08 <tmortagne> unless it's a flickering  
15:08 <mflorea> because it wasn't run yet  
15:08 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: it is ok for me, but I have recenlty pushed some commits so we should wait for the tests  
15:08 <mflorea> after the platform chagnes  
15:08 <tmortagne> ok  
15:11 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: now it works, it looks like one node failed to register to jgroup, thanks  
15:11 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: ok  
15:12 <DarkKnightCZ> by the way, are there any documents / case studies for xwiki HA solution (10k+ users)?  
15:14 <ClemensR> there is the Clustering admin guide: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Clustering  
15:14 <cjd> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curriki  
15:14 <cjd> ``Curriki has over 350,000 educator, parent, and student members, and has garnered over 8.5 million visits from around the world.''  
15:14 <cjd> it's running on XWiki  
15:16 <spu7nic> Hmm, can I circumvent the block restriction within the html macro? I am trying to get a modified version of the livetable macro working and he just throws "When using the HTML macro inline, you can only use inline HTML content. Block HTML content (such as tables) cannot be displayed. Try leaving an empty line before and after the HTML macro." at me :/  
15:17 <tmortagne> spu7nic: why don't do you what the error suggest ?  
15:17 <spu7nic> I already did ^^  
15:17 <tmortagne> then it was not on the right html macro  
15:18 <spu7nic> I just copied it from the macros.vm and added a few things  
15:18 <tmortagne> could you paste your entire code on pastbin or somehting like this ?  
15:18 <spu7nic> may it be a problem that I put the macro in a document and not within a vm file?  
15:18 <tmortagne> no it's not a problem  
15:19 <tmortagne> and it's not what the error is about anyway  
15:19 <spu7nic> http://pastebin.com/eZaYt7KN  
15:20 <spu7nic> I want to inject some additional hql filtering (security is no concern at the moment) into the LiveTableResults  
15:20 <tmortagne> spu7nic: that's your entire page content ?  
15:21 <spu7nic> tmortagne: It is  
15:21 <tmortagne> you are defining a filterablelivetable macro you don't seems to be using it anywhere  
15:21 <tmortagne> are you including this document somewhere else ?  
15:21 <spu7nic> exactly  
15:22 <spu7nic> http://pastebin.com/Y6XX0K0q  
15:23 <tmortagne> I don't think the issue is with this document containing the html macro  
15:23 <tmortagne> your issue is in http://pastebin.com/Y6XX0K0q  
15:24 <tmortagne> you have a parahraph with two macro in it so everything coming from these macro is inlince content (since it's paragraph content)  
15:24 <tmortagne> you need to isolate them  
15:24 <tmortagne> you can remove the empty lines you added before and after your html macro  
15:25 <spu7nic> tmortagne: thanks a lot :)  
15:25 <tmortagne> the rule about html macro is here to produce valid html (i.e. not having non inline content inside a <p> element)  
15:26 <spu7nic> great - makes sense, I just wasn't aware it rendered a paragraph :)  
15:27 <tmortagne> yea it's not always obvious, it's just that we apply the same rule to everything, a standalone element need to be isolated which means separated from other content by en empty line  
15:27 <tmortagne> in your case the include and velocity macros  
15:28 <spu7nic> thanks - you are the hero of the day :)  
15:29 <spu7nic> got it working :)  
15:33 <tmortagne> spu7nic: you're welcome :)

16:18 <vmassol> https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/9742221/raw/a5165e52750e6552e2182787a38fbf763ca9f4ee/gistfile1.txt  
16:18 <vmassol> (gdelhumeau)  
16:19 <vmassol> tmortagne: how do you load these translations btw? You have a custom CL for each extension to load them?  
16:19 <vmassol> (because with a single CL they'd be clashing)  
16:20 <tmortagne> no they would not clashing, the CL gives you all the resources with the provided name, the one giving you only one is actually a helper  
16:23 <vmassol> ah yes so you filter on the full JAR URL path  
16:23 <vmassol> right?  
16:23 <tmortagne> no  
16:23 <tmortagne> I just get all ApplicationsResources.properties files  
16:23 <vmassol> indeed, you don't need to filter :)  
16:24 <vmassol> you just load them all  
16:24 <tmortagne> yep  
16:24 <vmassol> easy...  
16:25 <tmortagne> (I still keep the URL to generate exact translation URLs)

16:25 <tmortagne> but we don't anymore  
16:26 <tmortagne> but it's not failing CL just gived you the first one  
16:26 <tmortagne> s/gived/gives/  
16:31 <vmassol> yes I know, that's the point of the duplicate finder plugin  
16:31 <vmassol> (to avoir such non deterministic issues)

16:54 <sbaloul> Hi everyone  
16:54 <sbaloul> I tried to make a release for applicatoin-forum2 and the releasing process fails with the message (see past been) http://hastebin.com/raduqokeya.vhdl  
16:55 <sbaloul>  The authenticity of host 'maven.xwiki.org' can't be established  
16:55 <vmassol> first, you should use nexus and not scp  
16:56 <vmassol> (nexus = http)  
16:56 <vmassol> let me check your pom.xml  
16:56 <vmassol> (it seems wrong)  
16:56 <vmassol> it's ok , it's using http  
16:57 <vmassol> why are you trying to use the deploy plugin?  
16:57 <vmassol> that's not the right way  
16:57 <tmortagne> sbaloul: you don't seems to be following http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HReleasetheproject  
16:57 <sbaloul> It's weired, I haven't change anything in the pom  
16:57 <vmassol> the probem is not the pom  
16:58 <vmassol> it's the way you're trying to release  
16:58 <vmassol> you're using the wrong way as indicated by tmortagne  
16:58 <sbaloul> release:perform  
16:58 <sbaloul> mvn release:perform  
16:58 <vmassol> release:prepare and release:perform  
16:58 <vmassol> hmm  
16:58 <tmortagne> you did prepare before perform ?  
16:58 <msmeria> has quit  
16:59 <sbaloul> no, only perform  
16:59 <vmassol> ok so that cannot work for sure  
16:59 <vmassol> see http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HReleasetheproject  
17:00 <tmortagne> I surprised perform is trying to even do anything  
17:00 <tmortagne> it should just fail since it has no information to do the release  
17:00 <vmassol> yes and I still don't understand why it's trying to use scp and not http  
17:02 <vmassol> (would need to run mvn help:effective-pom to figure this out)  
17:04 <sbaloul> Ok, I understand tmortagne, thanks  
17:04 <sbaloul> I'll run help:effective-pom  
17:04 <vmassol> Ive run it  
17:05 <sbaloul> ah ok  
17:05 <vmassol> and I know why :)  
17:05 <vmassol> it's becuase you haven't done release:prepare so it's trying to deploy a snapshot version  
17:05 <vmassol> and since your pom depends on 4.1 and doesn't override the repo for snapshot you have:  
17:06 <vmassol> https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/9743291/raw/611fc9800f6247ce30fa04cda360403b6ae9b587/gistfile1.txt  
17:06 <vmassol> which uses scp  
17:06 <vmassol> anyway now I understand  
17:06 <vmassol> so you just need to follow the documentation and you'll be fine :)
